1.definition: a violation of the lawa criminal act [nor shall any person be subject for the same to be twice put in jeopardy "amend. V"] see also

2.definition: an intentional unlawful act that causes damage to another and for which the law imposes an obligation for damages compareat,
2.note: Breach of contract, offenses, quasi-offenses, and quasi contracts are the bases for civil liability under the civil law. Offenses and quasi-offenses are comparable to common-law torts.
